Package com.terturl.MMO.Framework

Class InventoryUI

java.lang.Object
com.terturl.MMO.Framework.InventoryUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
Direct Known Subclasses:
QuestInventory, RecipeInventory, ShopInventory
public class InventoryUI extends Object implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
Handles the creation of Spigot Inventories much easier and faster
Since:
0.25.0
Author:
Sean Rahman

      Parameters:
      type - InventoryType to be displayed
      title - Title of the inventory

    • InventoryUI

      public InventoryUI​(int size, String title)
      Creates an InventoryUI of the specified size and title (Chest Inventory)
      Parameters:
      size - Size (% 9)
      title - Title of the inventory

      public void open​(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)

      Parameters:
      pls - Players to open

    • close

      public void close​(Iterable<org.bukkit.entity.Player> pls)
      Close the inventory for all of of the given players
      Parameters:
      pls - Players to close

    • close

      public void close​(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
      Properly closes Inventory for the given player and calls the onClose method. But can be skipped by just closing the players inventory
      Parameters:
      p - Player to close

    • addButton

      public void addButton​(InventoryButton but)

      public void markForUpdate​(int slot)

      Parameters:
      slot - Index to mark for update
